original_title: Sri Lanka bill yields fall across maturities at auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka sold 180 billion rupees of Treasury bills at an auction on Wednesday after offering 180 billion while yields across maturities fell, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 79.9 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 25.47 percent, down 33 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 90 billion rupees.
Of the 6-month bills 47.5 billion rupees worth of bills were sold at 25.22 percent, down 20 basis points from a week earlier.
52.6 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 22.79 percent, down 35 basis points from a week earlier after offering 45 billion. (Colombo/May 17/2022)
